title: How to Switch Off Inverted Colors on an iPhone

steps.title: Look for the gray cog icon on one of your home screens.
steps.content: Look for the gray cog icon on one of your home screens. It may be in the Utilities folder.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Accessibility.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Accessibility . You'll find it in the third group of settings.

steps.title: Tap Display & Text Size.
steps.content: Tap Display & Text Size . It's in the "Vision" section at the top of the page.

steps.title: Tap the switch next to "Classic Invert" to disable inverted colors.
steps.content: Tap the switch next to "Classic Invert" to disable inverted colors. This switch is about halfway down the page. The screen will immediately return to the original color settings (darker text on a light background). If the "Smart Invert" switch is set to the On/green position, you can also tap that switch to disable the feature.
